TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: maqinatsap a se Qalu (Qatsiłay village, p.162)

S.FORM: ka sitsuayan masengats a se Pungudan a vaik a paikinurił tua se Qalu.
ka sicoayan masengac a se Pongodan a vaik a paikinorilj toa se Qalo.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time the Pungudan people got tired of going to give a tribute of dried meat to the Qalu people.

S.FORM: manu limutseng a se Qalu; mirava, sa vaik a sema Pungudan a maqinatsap.
mano limoceng a se Qalo; mirava, sa vaik a sema Pongodan a maqinacap.
S.TRANSL: So the Qalu people were angry, and got ready and went to Pungudan to hunt heads.

S.FORM: djemałun tiamadju.
djemaljon tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: When they arrived,

S.FORM: kiqiła i pasulaulauz, a naremaung tua se Pungudan.
kiqilja i pasolaolaoz, a naremaong toa se Pongodan.
S.TRANSL: they hid below the village, ready to ambush the Pungudan people.

S.FORM: manu łengłengan a bulabulay a vavayan.
mano ljengljengan a bolabolay a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: But they saw a beautiful girl,

S.FORM: qau matjatjumatjumał tiamadju tu uzai a bulabulay a vavayan.
qao matjatjomatjomalj tiamadjo to ozai a bolabolay a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: and told one another that there was a beautiful girl.

S.FORM: qau małavar tiamadju: "iya ḍi.
qao maljavar tiamadjo: "iya dri.
S.TRANSL: And they decided: “Well now,

S.FORM: mayanga qemtsi a se Pungudan.
mayanga qemci a se Pongodan.
S.TRANSL: don’t kill the Pungudan people after all.

S.FORM: nangaq a vaik itjen a kivangavang tazua bulabulay a vavayan," aya tiamadju.
nangaq a vaik itjen a kivangavang tazoa bolabolay a vavayan," aya tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go and court the beautiful girl,” they said.

S.FORM: qau sualapen a tjakit, sa kelayan tua djarałap i tsasaw.
qao soalapen a tjakit, sa kelayan toa djaraljap i casaw.
S.TRANSL: They took off their swords and hung them on a banyan tree outside.

S.FORM: mavukuts a djarałap tua kinaliaw nua tjakit.
mavokoc a djaraljap toa kinaliaw noa tjakit.
S.TRANSL: The tree was bent over because there were so many swords.

S.FORM: qau sa vaik tiamadju a kivangavang a sema tjua bulabulay a vavayan.
qao sa vaik tiamadjo a kivangavang a sema tjoa bolabolay a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: So they went to the beautiful girl’s place to court her.

S.FORM: qau sa pakaivi anga azua bulabulay a vavayan.
qao sa pakaivi anga azoa bolabolay a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: And (eventually) the beautiful girl was given in marriage (to one of them).

S.FORM: manu djemałun i Qalu, sa muri kisudjuan.
mano djemaljon i Qalo, sa mori kisodjoan.
S.TRANSL: So they reached Qalu, and were going to make love.

S.FORM: manu neka nu nimadju; uzai a iku.
mano neka no nimadjo; ozai a iko.
S.TRANSL: But she had no private parts, and she had a tail.

S.FORM: qau "kudain anga tsu, a neka nu nimadju?" aya se Qalu.
qao "kodain anga co, a neka no nimadjo?" aya se Qalo.
S.TRANSL: “What’s the matter with her, with no private parts?” said the Qalu people.

S.FORM: manu djemałun tua sikapuḍuan nua vatu.
mano djemaljon toa sikapodroan noa vato.
S.TRANSL: Then the time came for dogs to be on heat;

S.FORM: mintu uzai anga a nimadju.
minto ozai anga a nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: and then she had her private parts.

S.FORM: sa kivadaqi anga azua vavayan tu tima kama, tu tima kina.
sa kivadaqi anga azoa vavayan to tima kama, to tima kina.
S.TRANSL: So the woman was asked who were her father and mother.

S.FORM: qau tjemumał azua vavayan: "tsautsau a ku kina; vatu a ku kama," aya tjemumał.
qao tjemomalj azoa vavayan: "caocao a ko kina; vato a ko kama," aya tjemomalj.
S.TRANSL: And she told them: “My mother is human; my father is a dog,” she said.

S.FORM: qau nu puałak azua vavayan, ḍusaḍusa nu puałak a kintał.
qao no poaljak azoa vavayan, drosadrosa no poaljak a kintalj.
S.TRANSL: And when she bore children she bore twins.
